column5:
Thank you so much for this comment. These are aspects I hadnâ€™t considered; the very real practicalities of being legally entwined.

Everyone in the comment section saying 8 months is too soon to consider marriage is totally correct, but itâ€™s not too soon to start having conversations about how we see our future.
Thatâ€™s alright, itâ€™s a totally legitimate point! Thanks for bringing it up :) I hope you and your loved ones are doing well during quarantine, itâ€™s a rough time for us all!
I completely agree with you! But neither of us wants to have kids :) Our wishes for the future are exactly the same: raising animals in the country.

He has simply told me that the â€˜paperâ€™ doesnâ€™t mean anything.

He is perfectly fine maintaining a monogamous, long-term relationship without it, which is great! Heâ€™s very loyal and dedicated and caring; heâ€™s been in long-term relationships before, which ended for unfortunate circumstances that had nothing to do with being non-committal. He really doesnâ€™t like the paperwork that makes a relationship â€œofficialâ€.

Thatâ€™s an idea...

And we could give each other rings (or other symbolic jewellery for daily wear) during this party.

I see what youâ€™re asking. I would like a marriage, and the kind of wedding would be (almost) irrelevant. The â€œmilestoneâ€ Iâ€™m referring to is the moment you become spouses and start that chapter.

We were already friends, and we liked spending time together... I wasnâ€™t really concerned about these differences because they didnâ€™t matter at first. But time went by, we went through some struggles, and we became very committed.
Thank you so much for this!! I had this thought but I couldnâ€™t quite put it into words in order to ask him about it.
Iâ€™m not wondering if I want to marry him, because yes, 8 months is WAY too soon. But because we know that we have this impasse, I donâ€™t want it to loom over us.

We agree on just about everything else; we have a really solid relationship, itâ€™s everything I could want in a partner and a friend, and thatâ€™s why Iâ€™m posting here.

Itâ€™s not a deal-breaker for me. As I read the comments tell me it is, I realize that it isnâ€™t. Itâ€™s more important to me to have him in my life than a wedding, but I donâ€™t want to feel like Iâ€™ve missed out on a milestone.
Yes!! Thank you for finding it! It looks like I got some of the details wrong, but the message stays the same.
If the roles were reversed, much of the advice would be the same: The boyfriend is insecure, and therefore there needs to be trust established.

No, itâ€™s not necessary!

TL;DR ask your lady why she needs to see your phone, and try to find a common ground to establish trust and confidence.

It sounds like your girlfriend is insecure. She clearly wants to make sure that you arenâ€™t crossing boundaries with other women. You should ask her, â€œWhy do you think I might be cheating? What can we do to assuage your fears?â€ Note the WE in that sentence: she needs to work on her confidence as well. She may even need to see a therapist if she is extremely worried/obsessed over the idea of you cheating on her.

I donâ€™t like giving my partners my phone because it has private conversations on them. Between my friends, my family, online... Iâ€™m just not comfortable with the idea of my partner digging through and analyzing my data. I often talk to my friends about sensitive subjects. I often Google embarrassing things (ie â€œdefinition judiciousâ€) â€” and I think that some of those stupid Google searches, or porn preferences, or other trivial Internet things should be kept private. I truly have nothing to hide from my boyfriend â€” I would happily let him scroll through it all if he really needed to â€” itâ€™s just my pride.

HOWEVER. I also see your girlfriendâ€™s side. I was in a horrible relationship that was FULL of distrust. Long story short, he made me feel like trash, and I wanted to go through his phone/computer so, so bad. I was certain that he was talking shit about me / flirting with other women.

In my current relationship, I know he isnâ€™t cheating on me and vice versa. We are honest and transparent about our feelings, good and bad. Iâ€™ve never asked to look through his texts, nor has he looked through mine. We know we need a degree of privacy. So we started reassuring each other from the beginning.
I thought this was The Fray, which would be just as appropriate. Where did I go wrong, I lost a friend, somewhere along in the bitterness... ğŸ˜‚

I donâ€™t mind with this person, since they saved me through Eden on my first run. Maybe he will send one back, Iâ€™m not sure yet, but itâ€™s okay if he never does :)

Iâ€™m not afraid to be the friend that sends one first (because *someone* has to be the first giver!) but the feeling of rejection does smart. I know that I can get the candles back, though :)

Iâ€™m learning to be very selective with who I add; some folks are more attentive than others when it comes to reciprocation. Since I bought a Season Pass, I donâ€™t want to waste time on anyone who isnâ€™t as interested in the game mechanics as I am!

Iâ€™ve found some awesome people!! I just thought it was funny watching my bf play and he was basically trying to speedrun it ğŸ˜‚ So impatient!

I have yet to get a group thatâ€™s patient enough to do the butterfly challenge, so I have yet to meet the pupper, but Iâ€™ll keep visiting to give it a try!
Sorry! Iâ€™ve been looking through this sub and Iâ€™m still trying to figure out the lingo ğŸ˜… Thank you for linking me!

Iâ€™d like to add that, in your example, the first and second questions provide a vastly different image of you.

The first question: An ignorant numbnut who canâ€™t even use Google. Iâ€™m not even American, and I can name a few â€œbad thingsâ€. I wouldnâ€™t want to respond to you because where even do I start?! Someone with the patience of a kindergarten teacher can answer instead of me...
In your second example of the blender, this is like asking, â€œHow do I use my blender?â€ and my answer would be, â€œWhat do you mean? Read your fucking user manual, dipshit.â€

The second question: A right-winger or centrist who is feeling frisky; you want someone to argue with you. The people youâ€™d attract are not going to be patient, and are not going to talk to you like youâ€™re 5; theyâ€™re going to insult you, theyâ€™re going to talk from a high horse, and they may pick and choose their sources.
In your blender example, you might get people who know how to rewire their blender to make one of the buttons play Africa by Toto, and theyâ€™ll use complicated vocabulary to make you feel like a moron.

I find the best way is to be specific. â€œTrump killed 1,000 baby panda bears via AR-15, and I know thatâ€™s bad, but why is everyone mad that it wasnâ€™t eco-friendly?!â€ would get more precise responses than â€œWhy shouldnâ€™t we kill panda bear babies?â€

THIS ^

Although OP has mentioned that they used this tactic to get answers about their blender by insulting the product/manufacturer, where the audience jumped on and corrected them. In that instance I think you could easily get excellent information.

But in the case of wishy-washy topics like politics, philosophy, religion... then absolutely, youâ€™re going to get replies from folks who firmly believe in their school of thought and want to convert you to â€œtheir sideâ€ â€” which could include bending the truth. There are also folks that will use public forums to post their responses as a form of propaganda; not to inform you or correct you, necessarily, but to use the comment section to campaign for a certain cause so that OTHER users may sway in their direction.

Thereâ€™s a lot of nuance in that video that I think gets skimmed over...

The first sign is intentionally inflammatory. It uses strong language and it targets a vulnerable population. Of course some people are going to see it and be offended.

The second sign is a call to action...without any immediate action for the reader to take. What did he want the passersby to do? Give him money? Give him a handshake? Itâ€™s unclear, which played right into the producerâ€™s hands; it made people seem apathetic about the cause. Iâ€™d be one of those people because Iâ€™d read the sign and think, â€œObviouslyâ€ and keep walking. Because a lot of us already donate what we can to the less fortunate!

I guarantee that anyone who stopped to berate him for the first sign is helping the poor in their community (in whichever way they believe is best).
On my very fun run through Eden I had no idea what I was in for â€” and a stranger stuck by my side the whole way. I named him â€œSaviourâ€ because I was so grateful for his help.

I introduced my boyfriend to Sky last night â€” thinking it would be nice to play co-op and give each other hearts â€” and he was SO impatient! I donâ€™t think itâ€™s a game for us to play together ğŸ˜…
Could you tell me what you mean by â€œspirit truckâ€ and â€œcrab artâ€?
Since I still have to go a few more times, Iâ€™m happy to be your buddy and save your wings :) DM me anytime.
How does one play with krills? I think theyâ€™re so scary ğŸ™ˆ
I agree with that exception!
Even if there isnâ€™t a reward, I donâ€™t find the level enjoyable, I find it incredibly stressful and scary :( So after I get all the buffs, Iâ€™m never touching Eden again!!!!
I found a few strangers on the way, and luckily we all know how unforgiving Eden is, so we stuck together... It made me appreciate how pure this game can be <3
I love all of these!! This is so cute!

Itâ€™s not evolutionarily beneficial, itâ€™s just left over from our ancestors :) We donâ€™t really have hair left, so thereâ€™s no point in getting goosebumps at all. When we no longer have hair follicles, we wonâ€™t be able to get them.

We have a wide range of emotions aside from fear or anger; our bodies donâ€™t have a straightforward response to nostalgia or dÃ©jÃ  vu, so any â€œunsettlingâ€ or â€œunexpectedâ€ emotion registers the same way.

I believe Iâ€™ve experienced what youâ€™re talking about. It has happened to me when I get a dizzy spell from low blood sugar.

My eyes also focus and unfocus when Iâ€™m tired. Staring at a screen or reading for too long could be making your eyes tired.

EDIT: Of course, only an optometrist can say for sure if itâ€™s nothing to worry about!

Animals have emotional responses like fear and aggression that trigger â€œgoosebumpsâ€. 

Goosebumps are designed to move the hair on our arms, and other mammals have the same mechanisms. When a dog is scared or threatened, its hackles are raised (the fur on the back of its neck stand up straight); this is to make the dog seem bigger. The same thing happens with cats when they stand sideways and raise their tails straight up.

No; spending time at home unwinding is more important to me. An extra hour - after working for 8-10 hours - is a long time to spend on transit. That is, if I could comfortably afford the faster transportation.

Thatâ€™s very sweet of you :) When you love your pet, youâ€™ll go out of your way to make sure they stay happy and healthy <3 Iâ€™ve had 4 old dogs over my life and now I have 2 young cats; they fill up my heart and I would give them the world.

One of my favourite quotes, from Roger Caras: â€œDogs are not our whole life, but they make our lives whole.â€

Iâ€™m glad that being kind to your furry friend made you feel uplifted. Sending lots of love to both of you!
I wonâ€™t :) I donâ€™t want to be involved with her in any way. If I was blatantly rude, I have no doubt it would bite me later. (I like to daydream about it though...)

Honestly.

Her basis was that I have â€œa high forehead, blue eyes, and ugly teethâ€. Iâ€™m pretty sure I saw red when I found out. I was 24 and I kept my mouth shut â€” because I grew up on the idea of â€œnever burn your bridgesâ€ â€” and a part of me wants a bit of revenge for holding my tongue all this time.

I've never owned a cat before, but my boyfriend has 2 young ones (3 and 4). They're really good, considering, but I wasn't prepared for the amount of mischief!  Any closed door is the enemy, my face is a crosswalk, my chargers are secret snacks... Not to mention one of them is completely blind, so he sometimes gets "stuck" on the kitchen table and yells for help.

But don't get me wrong, I fell in love with them immediately, and I would commit unspeakable crimes for them.

The is the perfect analogy for grief.

The waves don't stop. But they do become smaller over time, and you can swim well enough to come out the other side. You can keep breathing and keep living once you get through the biggest swells.

Hey there u/Broad-Panda.

I can't tell you how much my heart hurts for you, your family, and Honey's family. No one should ever, \*ever\* experience such a tragedy.

Could you tell me why you can't talk to your therapist about your feelings? It's a lot to keep all of this bottled up. Posting on the Internet is a great start to opening up, but it sounds like you feel alone. You aren't alone.

I've had my own experiences with violent death. The grief truly knocks the wind out of you, and there's nothing but time that can make it easier; I remember trying to talk about my sadness with friends, and all they could do was look at me with pity and say "Oh that sucks". It's beyond frustrating.

I promise you can heal. You'll never forget her, but you'll find yourself.

There's a resource that I used during a horrible time of grief and guilt. It's a 12- or 16-step process of writing letters to yourself, to your family, to the person responsible, and to your loved one. I can look for it if you're interested. It's not an official therapeutic resource, it was just from a forum, but it was cathartic to express all of the feelings I kept inside.

Please remember that you are still alive. And you deserve to feel fulfilled and loved. Honey is still a part of you and always will be, and hopefully in the future her spirit will help you find reasons to enjoy living again.

I'm sending you all my love.

I would, however my ex has been pretty clear on distancing himself from me, so if I went around him and contacted his girlfriend it would seem like I was nosing around. I like my ex well enough, and I donâ€™t want to step on any toes, even if I mean well.

I can only trust that she (as a 31-year-old) is able to hold her own ground and implement her own boundaries.

Certainly, if she reached out to me about MIL, I would be happy to offer her a shoulder to lean on.

We arenâ€™t close anymore, so having that sort of chat isnâ€™t possible. We only connect once in a blue moon.

When we were together, he didnâ€™t have a spine, but hopefully thatâ€™s changed and he and his lady are rock solid.
LMFAO THATS PRICELESS!!!!

Oh boy! I hadnâ€™t even thought of that angle. (These JNMILs are crafty buggers...) I wondered briefly if she was getting the same treatment. Thatâ€™s really cruel, I would never want my existence to make her feel self-conscious :(

Youâ€™re right, youâ€™re right. There was a part of me that wanted to be super petty, and it would be so cathartic to finally give her a piece of my mind.

But youâ€™re right. I should walk away knowing my life is tenfold better without her antics.
Wow, I think itâ€™s an understatement to call that an invasion of privacy... I hope she paid for that!

Congratulations on your recovery! <3

Having self-image issues makes it so hard to know whether youâ€™re being treated with respect. After reading a lot of these comments, it sounds like youâ€™ve had a chance to step back and evaluate things objectively. You seem so insightful, considerate, and smart!

When I started spending the night at my partner's, I came to learn that he snored. Like, really bad. I couldn't sleep around him, so I didn't stay over on worknights, only on Fridays or Saturdays when being exhausted the next day wouldn't hurt.

After a couple of months of mentioning that he might have sleep apnea, he got tested, and got a machine. The snoring didn't bother \*him\* - he was a loud sleeper for years - but he wanted me to be comfortable at his place so he put in the effort. That's the bare, bare minimum.

If he threw a hissy fit any time I slept on the couch because I couldn't sleep, I never would've spent the night again.

You're so right! Once you start dating someone that is respectful and knows how to communicate, it's like someone pulls a blindfold off of your face. You can finally see how two adults should coexist!

I bent over backwards for my ex; I always went to his place, his 'free time' was doing DIY projects while I sat and watched, he complained that my interests were a waste of time so we never did them... (And many other not-nice things on top of that.)

I wasted many years with him, and my current boyfriend is just everything I could've asked for. Neither of us feels entitled to each other's time or attention. We moved in together RIGHT before the pandemic started affecting us, so even with the close-quarters in a 1-bedroom apartment, we're doing amazing :) It goes to show that there really are partners out there that will go above and beyond to love us. Don't settle for anyone less than amazing!

Right before the pandemic, I moved in with my boyfriend - it was literally three days before our government started advising social distancing and a week before his work shut down. I completely understand couples navigating togetherness during this quarantine.

Like you, I need time to recharge my batteries or I get short-tempered. My boyfriend is an affectionate chatterbox. I let him know when I need quiet time, and he goes into the other room to play games. I also have mental health issues, so when I'm not feeling like myself, I tell him and he is very attentive.

It's confusing to me that your boyfriend is offended by your habits. It sounds like you've been clear by telling him exactly when you need alone time and why, and yet it doesn't seem to matter to him.

In my opinion, he feels cooped up in a new living situation but isn't as in tune with his feelings as you are. What I mean is that you know when you're starting to feel uneasy/stressed, you know why, and you know how to handle it. Maybe he feels cooped up in a new living situation but doesn't know how to handle feelings of loneliness/frustration when you spend time away from him. And it ended up blowing out of proportion when it didn't have to.

Some time apart for self-reflection sounds like a good thing for both of you. I wouldn't immediately think that the relationship is over, because he could apologize, so feel free to keep that door open. But **in the end, he does need to respect your needs.** If he wants you to constantly hang around with him and listen to him talk about things you aren't interested in, then he might as well have a mannequin sit next to him.

Enjoy your wine tonight, and I hope things work out for you :)

I believe you read my short comment and assumed that I lack the ability to perceive nuance. At no point did I say that he should give away all his wealth until he is below the poverty line. I would never suggest that to anyone.

I used the example of the shop owner because of the sentiment that giving people can never get rich in the first place. They would recognize that the money they donâ€™t need for themselves and their loved ones could meet the basic needs of others. The idea is that they wouldnâ€™t accumulate more money than they could spend because they would perceive that as wasteful. (And, for the record, lower-middle class isnâ€™t poverty.)

Additionally, how is the fact that many charities are corrupt a reason not to donate to good causes? Because Greenpeace and the WWF and PETA are sketchy, we shouldnâ€™t bother trying to contribute to the causes we care about? Thatâ€™s bologna. For every big charity that pours money into sponsorships and advertising and â€œadministrative feesâ€, there are dozens of smaller, local charities that are doing a better job. The only thing holding someone back is either a lack of research into charities or a lack of interest in donating.

And yes, it is a cruel power to be able to choose who is â€œworthyâ€ of financial support and who isnâ€™t at his level. My extra pocket change for charity is *nothing* compared to his life-changing pocket change.

Iâ€™m aware that if Gatesâ€™ money went into one place â€” or even 100 places â€” all at once, it would be too much money all at once to be used effectively. I donâ€™t have an ideal plan on how to distribute it. What Iâ€™m saying is that kind of extraordinary wealth doesnâ€™t â€” and should never â€” belong in one manâ€™s account.

Iâ€™m so glad I could depict your idea :D I felt like I could write a full, 5000-word story on it, so I tried to keep it short. Maybe if Iâ€™m still itching to write the rest tomorrow, I could DM you? ;)

I did not claw my way from the depths of the inferno only to be disrespected. I had proven myself formidable by breaking through the wall to the material plane, and I did *not* intend to go ignored.

I listened and waited for the perfect targets: naÃ¯ve young women and men trying both to court each other and prove their courage by sitting around a ouija board in the dark. It was classic and easy. They spoke to me, I spoke to them, and they accused each other of playing pranks. I fought my way to the door between their plane and mine, prematurely tasting victory. I clung to the girl holding the planchette, eager to harness her fear to fuel my power.

Oh how disappointed I was to find that centuries had turned humans from quivering and god-fearing into indifferent, dopamine-seeking creatures. They werenâ€™t afraid of the dark, superstition, pagans, or mystery like they used to be. In the 16th century I had been almighty. I was nearly impossible to catch and exorcize... I escaped returning to Hell countless times.

And yet, Lisa seemed an insurmountable task.

On the second night, when I felt I was firmly planted in the material plane, I began my work on weakening her constitution. It took her a long time to fall asleep, but at three in the morning, I had my first chance.

I pushed a glass jar from one of the top cupboards. It shattered entirely when it hit the floor, spraying brine and pickled vegetables in all directions. I listened, and I was pleased that Iâ€™d woken her up.

She skittered into the kitchen and flipped the light on. â€œPingu?!â€ she called.

Iâ€™d made an amateur mistake: anything I did outside of her vision would be blamed on the cat. Drat.

The following days, I watched her closely. She slept in, she ate, she slept, she smoked an herb, she watched a film, she looked at her cellular phone, she looked out the window, she ate...

She made no attempt to leave. Her tuxedo cat spent as much time by her side as by himself, so I tried to keep careful track of him.

On the fifth day, while Lisa watched another movie, I wanted to make up for my earlier failure. I took hold of her bedframe and shook it back and forth, making the springs squeak, for a few seconds. It took a fair amount of strength, but her fear would be more than enough to gain it back... Or so I though.

Lisa picked up her phone. â€œHey Siri. Text Mom. Yo I think we just got an earthquake question mark. Send.â€

She resumed her movie looking quite not-scared. I clenched my teeth and growled to myself, at which point Lisa looked up and shouted, â€œPingu? Are you growling at me buddy? Itâ€™s not suppertime yet.â€

I mustered up the strength for one more try that night. Right as Lisa slipped into REM sleep, I took hold of her ankles as hard as I could and dragged her from the bed. She woke up and yelped when her head hit the floor, much to my pleasure. To my displeasure, however, she lugged herself back under the covers without hesitation.

The next morning, she called someone on her phone. â€œI had *the* craziest dream last night and guess what. No, even funnier,â€ she said, beginning to giggle. â€œI fell out of my fucking bed! Can you believe that? I havenâ€™t fallen out of bed since I was, like, eleven.â€

She didnâ€™t even notice the bruises because she didnâ€™t shower for three days.

It took a while for me to plan my next move. I needed her fear or I would fade into a pathetic shadow of the demon I wanted to be, and I wasnâ€™t very strong after my resurgence to begin with.

I was ready a week later. Unexpectedly, Lisa went out one evening and didnâ€™t return until very late. She collapsed into bed, still wearing her clothes, and fell asleep immediately. I placed my gnarled hands on her bare shoulders, and raked my nails down her arms, leaving bright red welts in their wake. To my dismay, she didnâ€™t even stir, but I had some hope for the next morningâ€™s revelation.

Lisa sat up in the afternoon and started smoking, probably before she was fully conscious. She leaned back on her pillow and exhaled, lying there for a while before taking another hit. I tried to fight my impatience as I waited.

It was when she leaned over to the ashtray that she caught a glimpse of the marks on her smooth skin. She examined herself for a few moments before muttering, â€œWhat the fuck?â€

She picked up her phone. â€œHey Siri. Call Adam From Lab 2. Hey, itâ€™s me. Dude, did you scratch me last night? I appreciate the passion, but this isnâ€™t very cool...â€

I decided to take that damned phone. That would be the way to get her attention. I was driven by frustration; as soon as she set the phone down after talking to Adam From Lab 2, I snatched it. I rushed to a different room - any room would do - and left it under a stack of textbooks.

It took six hours for Lisa to notice and two more for her to care enough to get up. She clicked a button on her laptop and the phone - that was supposed to be hidden - started making noises. She found it in no time.

â€œDid I...?â€ She scratched her head. â€œDid I do that...?â€

I could have screamed.

I screamed and kicked my laundry basket in the direction of the doorway, desperately leaping into my closet.

â€œWHAT THE FUCK?!â€ I shrieked through the half-closed door.

â€œOh my god,â€ came the mumbled reply. â€œOh my god Iâ€™m so sorry. Iâ€™ll just, uh, Iâ€™ll wait in the hallway, Iâ€™m so sorry....â€

The young manâ€™s footsteps left my bedroom and stopped a few feet away in the hall. I tried to catch my breath but the fright of a stranger appearing out of thin air while I was bare-ass-naked was strong. I instinctively felt around the floor beside me before I realized I left my phone on my nightstand; if I walked over to that side of my room, I would be in the manâ€™s field of view.

I tried to shake off my jitters and summon some confidence. My second-storey window was maybe fifteen feet off the ground... I began to weigh my chances of running on a broken ankle.

â€œListen, Miss, I honestly didnâ€™t mean to intrude,â€ came the strangerâ€™s shaky, embarrassed voice. â€œPlease let me explain.â€

My fear turned into rage in a split second. Did he trip and *accidentally* commit breaking and entering?! Did he turn left instead of right and OOPS Iâ€™m in a womanâ€™s bedroom?!

â€œGet the fuck out of my house or youâ€™ll have to explain to the local police department!â€ I stood up and began to wrestle with a sweater.

â€œIâ€™m from the year 2320-â€œ

â€œAnd my momâ€™s the president.â€

â€œ-and I came here by a chronoporter and I honestly didnâ€™t mean to end up in here I actually wanted to knock on your front door-â€œ

I finally managed to pull some track pants over my legs and I stomped out of the closet towards the source of the voice. â€œGET. OUT. OF. MY-â€œ

As soon as the young man caught sight of me - long hair still wet and wild from my shower, spittle flying off my lips, fists clenched, eyes wide and feral - he tripped over his own feet scrambling backwards.

â€œPlease!â€ he begged, holding his hands up. â€œI swear I didnâ€™t mean to scare you!â€

I halted. We stared at each other. I crossed my arms.

â€œOkay, asshole, what did you â€˜meanâ€™ to do?â€

He lowered his hands and licked his lips. He was handsome: curly blonde hair, blue eyes. His fragile face reminded me of that guy in the Fantastic Beasts movie. (...What was his name? Iâ€™ll have to look it up later when my house isnâ€™t being invaded by delusional teenagers.) He wore jeans but with stripes of something that looked like carbon fibre. He wore knee-high brown, suede boots that looked like Oxfords at the bottom. His shirt was a regular black sweater except the sleeves were attached with zippers. He wore purple glasses with a sharp cat-eye point on the corner of each lens. Certainly, it wasnâ€™t the strangest outfit Iâ€™d seen, but I still judged the tacky, â€˜cyberpunkâ€™ vibe he was obviously trying for.

â€œI told y-you,â€ he stuttered, â€œI wanted to talk to you so I was going to knock on your door, but the chronoporter sent me into your room. I didnâ€™t mean to!â€

â€œA chronoporter? Is this a *joke*?â€

â€œNo! Hang on... Hang on!â€

He reached into his pocket and pulled out a very ergonomic remote control. He offered it to me, and I allowed myself to step forward and take it.

It was heavy. It had a green dial and a colourful strip of glass. I rotated it in my hands, but no matter the angle, I didnâ€™t recognize what it was for or how it worked. I glared at him.

â€œI know youâ€™ve never seen anything like that before,â€ he said as fast as his mouth would allow him, â€œbut itâ€™s for a-a-a gadget that was invented in the 2200â€™s that can let you visit different years-â€œ

â€œA time machine. Youâ€™re telling me you have a time machine.â€

â€œYeah! I mean...â€ His facial expression shifted from happiness to wariness in an instant as he caught on to my skepticism. â€œYou could call it a time machine...â€

He was so deep in his delusion that I began to worry. He was clearly mentally ill; maybe he was having an episode, or forgot to take his medications, or both... He needed to go back to where he came from to get some help.

â€œOkay. Iâ€™ll humour you. Letâ€™s say you do have a *time machine*. Who are you?â€ I leaned against the hallway wall.

â€œIâ€™m Tungel.â€

I nearly snorted. Tungel. Like the unflattering nickname for Tumblr, â€˜tungl dot hellâ€™. Who named their kid â€˜Tungelâ€™?! It reminded me of Norman Reedusâ€™ son, Mingus Reedus. Or that stupid meme, Scrummy Bungus And The Crungy Spungus or something equally nonsensical. Really? Tungel?

I somehow managed to keep a straight face. â€œOkay, Tungel, what are you doing here?â€

â€œA school project. Itâ€™s for World History Post-Y2K, I need to study a historical figure, and Iâ€™ve always been a fan of yours, but I guess thatâ€™s weird since you donâ€™t even know who I am...â€

â€œYeah. Itâ€™s weird.â€

I took a step back towards my bedroom when Tungel shouted, â€œWAIT!â€ and grabbed my wrist. In my shock, I froze for a moment, and he managed to press a button on his remote. Our surroundings turned monochrome and the outer edges of my vision was blurry, as if I was peering through a fisheye lens.

â€œSorry,â€ he muttered as I wrested my arm out of his grasp. â€œI just need you to believe me.â€

Hey darling,

I know how you feel. You know who you fell in love with, and sometimes you still feel that pure, wonderful bliss with him when he is good to you. You want to work with him to try to get back the affection and kindness and respect that you had in the beginning. You want to find out what changed and try to fix it.

But at the end of the day, if he swears at you and hits you and neglects your mental health, he doesnâ€™t respect you. When someone doesnâ€™t respect you, they certainly arenâ€™t going to cooperate with you to change their behaviour.

If you try to talk to him about why his behaviours bother you and he turns it into a tirade about how itâ€™s all your fault, he doesnâ€™t want to change. He wants you to be his doormat so he can do and say whatever he wants without consequences. He has demonstrated that he doesnâ€™t care about how his actions affect other people. Iâ€™m going to say what other commenters have said: itâ€™s abusive. You need to get out. I know how hard it is to realize, but Iâ€™ve been in your shoes. I was with that man for 6 years. I wish I could get those years back. Leaving him was one of the hardest things Iâ€™ve ever done, but Iâ€™m a much healthier and happier woman for it.

Your boyfriend likes who he is and thereâ€™s nothing you can do about that. You could suggest he gets therapy, but unless he actually wants to improve himself it wonâ€™t help; he will go and â€œcheck the boxâ€ to â€œmake you happyâ€.

The only thing you can change is yourself. You know your mental health, and if he threatens you while youâ€™re manic, then thatâ€™s harmful. You need to protect yourself. If you canâ€™t trust him to keep you safe during your episodes (or, god forbid, you donâ€™t trust him not to trigger you) then itâ€™s not good for you to be around him at all. I know itâ€™s a hard realization, but it really took me to the point of suicide to finally break up with my ex. He was absolutely toxic for me, and I donâ€™t want you to feel stuck they way I did.

There are people out there that love you and wouldnâ€™t dream of hurting you. A relationship does not have to have violence, insults, or rape. (If your boyfriend is pushing you to have sex when you donâ€™t want to or in ways you donâ€™t want to, thatâ€™s rape.) A relationship can be extremely chill, where no one walks on eggshells and no one yells. You deserve that kind of love.

You know itâ€™s their needs because they are starting to feel a push towards â€œI canâ€™t continue with this non-exclusive relationship foreverâ€. It doesnâ€™t sound like theyâ€™re feeling jealous or possessive; they are considering their emotional investment, and whether or not it would start to harm them if this relationship continues the way it is. Itâ€™s a need because they donâ€™t want to leave the relationship, but they know that not being exclusive is causing her discomfort.

Desires and needs often cross over so thereâ€™s nothing wrong with it being both :) The only problem is when they donâ€™t overlap, our desires can hurt us.

Iâ€™ve had communications issues in relationships over the last decade, and Iâ€™ve done lots of reading and therapy to try to figure it out.

Like other users have said, itâ€™s up to him to sort it out. His communication troubles have nothing to do with you; youâ€™ve done nothing wrong. But itâ€™s amazing that youâ€™re there to support him! Iâ€™m sure he appreciates your patience. Talking about the discrepancy is an awesome first step.

This could stem from a plethora of things. He might not feel listened to, he might feel like a burden, he might feel emasculated by his own feelings. Does he have any mental illnesses? I do, and communicating important things can feel like the weight of the world is on your shoulders, so itâ€™s â€œeasierâ€ to bury it. (But, like you said, it gets to a boiling point.) Anger is known as a â€œsecondary emotionâ€; usually there is already something emotional going on in someoneâ€™s head before another trigger (like finding out your SO hasnâ€™t done the dishes yet) transforms it into anger.

I donâ€™t think neither he nor you can figure this out without professional help. He clearly has something big that prevents him from being honest sometimes, and itâ€™s going to take heavy lifting from him (and gentle support from you) to move it. Trying to figure it out on your own could be invasive, confusing, and frustrating for him. If you canâ€™t afford therapy right now, there might be some local support groups or online forums where he can hear from other people with similar experiences.

All the best to you both!! xo

Life Pro Tip: When you want something from a relationship (friends/family/romantic partner), donâ€™t worry about hurting their feelings. I used to walk on eggshells in case I was â€œasking for too muchâ€; in the end, I was mostly hurting myself by bottling up my needs and making myself anxious.

When youâ€™re ready to have this talk, I would open with the question, â€œHow would you feel about being exclusive?â€ This way, he can tell you how he feels about committing to you before you confess your feelings. Then you can have an open discussion from there about where you both stand.

I have a collage of mental illnesses, so obviously my brain chemistry is all kinds of whack.

But the way I look at it is that your lack of serotonin makes it ten times harder to handle bad news. Depression is never â€œjustâ€ brain chemistry; itâ€™s brain chemistry plus rejection or loss or bad luck.

Many, many people wouldnâ€™t be depressed because of what thrusts us into an episode. But we are predisposed to feel HORRIBLE instead of just bad. On the other hand, sometimes a tragic incident can make someone depressed and alter their brain chemistry. Both environment AND brain chemistry go hand-in-hand with depression.

And it is possible to recover. I did DBT (Dialectical Behaviour Therapy) and felt significantly different. I still have all of my disorders, but my quality of life has improved tremendously.
